You can send it<br>to me.<br>Best regards,<br>RM [...] Sally Little 2015-02-20T11:48:26+00:00 2015-02-20T11:48:26+00:00 ECSA 55 Unbounded boundaries and shifting baselines: Estuaries and coastal seas in a rapidly changing world https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOARCHAEOLOGY;a0d66253.1502 *Apologies for cross-posting*<br><br>Dear colleagues,<br><br>Join us at ECSA\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds next major Symposium, ECSA 55 - Unbounded boundaries and shifting baselines: Estuaries and coastal seas in a rapidly changing world, from the 6-9 September 2015 in London, UK.<br><br>ECSA 55 will bring together a global multi-disciplinary community of researchers and professionals to discuss and address issues of outstanding scientific importance in the science and management of estuaries and coastal seas. The symposium will focus on learning lessons from the past, discussing the current and forecasting for the future, spanning environmental, anthropogenic and climatic impacts on estuaries and coastal seas across the [...] Lisa Shillito 2015-02-17T08:14:37+00:00 2015-02-17T08:14:37+00:00 Fwd: 1st Circular of the Micromorphology Workshop https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOARCHAEOLOGY;4b3f84a3.1502 Sent from my iPhone<br><br>Begin forwarded message:<br><br>> From: Rosa Maria <rosa.poch@macs.udl.cat><br>> Date: 17 February 2015 08:09:56 GMT<br>> To: destinataris-ocults:;<br>> Subject: 1st Circular of the Micromorphology Workshop<br>><br>><br>> Dear Colleague,<br>> Please find enclosed a message from Lidija Galovic. (Anthropology)" <david.anderson@abdn.ac.uk><br>> Subject: 3-Year Post-doctoral pPosition: Geoarchaeology, Organic Chemistry, Ethnoarchaeology, University of Aberdeen<br>><br>> Dear colleagues,<br>><br>> I would be very grateful if you could circulate this advertisement on your lists. The deadline for applications for this 3-year post-doc, funded by the ESRC, is 4 February, 2015.<br>><br>> Thank you very much for your help.<br>><br>> Best wishes,<br>> Karen [...] Amy Ellison 2015-01-08T14:21:41+00:00 2015-01-08T14:21:41+00:00 Read the first article published in new open access journal STAR: Science and Technology of Archaeological Research https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOARCHAEOLOGY;eeb8e86c.1501 The first article has been published in our new open access journal STAR.<br><br>Read the article here: http://www.maneyonline.com/doi/abs/10.1179/2054892314Y.0000000002<br><br>Title: Complications in the study of ancient tuberculosis: non-specificity of IS6110 PCRs<br><br>Authors: Professor Terry Brown, and Romy Muller, University of Manchester, UK<br>Professor Charlotte Roberts, Durham University, UK<br><br>The insertion sequence IS6110 is frequently used as a marker for the presence of ancient DNA from bacteria of the Mycobacterium tuberculosis complex in human archaeological remains. The specificity of polymerase chain reactions directed at IS6110 has, however, been questioned, because identical or similar elements have been identified in 'mycobacteria other than tuberculosis'. There will be a plenary session on the [...] Lisa-Marie Shillito 2014-04-23T17:23:41+01:00 2014-04-23T17:23:41+01:00 Fwd: Re: Environmental assistant https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOARCHAEOLOGY;c3d18f8f.1404 ---------- Forwarded message ----------<br>From: Aleks Pluskowski <a.g.pluskowski@reading.ac.uk><br>Date: 23 April 2014 17:12<br>Subject: Fwd: Re: Environmental assistant<br>To: Lisa-Marie Shillito <lisa@palaeo.eu><br><br>"<br><br>*Calling all Environmental Archaeologists! The Lyminge Archaeological<br>project needs to recruit an enthusiastic Trainee Environmental Supervisor<br>for the 2014 summer season (running between Monday 21st July to Sunday 31st<br>August). *This role is ideal for a current student of environmental<br>archaeology* and will involve sampling and processing material from a<br>diverse range of archaeological contexts on the site of an early<br>Anglo-Saxon royal **vill * [...] Emily Simpson 2014-04-09T12:29:27+01:00 2014-04-09T12:29:27+01:00 NEW OPEN ACCESS JOURNAL: Science and Technology of Archaeological Research https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOARCHAEOLOGY;1a6471b1.1404 Maney Publishing is pleased to announce the launch of a new open access journal entitled Science and Technology of Archaeological Research (STAR).<br><br>STAR seeks to provide a dynamic, international and high quality open access forum for rapid publication of archaeological research resulting from the application of scientific and computational methods. The journal embraces the full breadth of archaeological enquiry, no periods, regions or site types are excluded. For publication in the core journal, STAR stipulates only that the article demonstrates the significance of the scientific or computational methods used to the archaeological knowledge base. STAR aims to provide first editorial [...]
